availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Residence: Grayson Springs, Grayson County, KY. A Kentucky-born farmer. Son of Samuel Paris and Nancy Ann Mings. Married Eliza Depanna Prewitt. Father of John S. Paris, Sarah P. Paris, Charles Taylor Paris, William Riley Paris, and Lloyd Clellan Paris.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, Grayson Springs post office, p. 18.

Find A Grave, Entry for Moses Paris (1814-1897), Find A Grave Memorial # 154593996, Paris Cemetery, Clarkson, Grayson County, Kentucky, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=paris&GSfn=moses&GSbyrel=all&GSdy=1897&GSdyrel=in&GSob=n&GRid=154593996&df=all& (accessed 29 June 2017).
